title: Config
description: You can find the documentation of the configuration file [here](https://release-plz.ieni.dev/docs/config).

package.title: Package
package.description: Package-specific configuration. This overrides `workspace`. Not all settings of `workspace` can be overridden.

workspace.title: Workspace
workspace.description: Global configuration. Applied to all packages by default.

body.description: Template that represents a single release in the changelog. It contains the commit messages. This is a [tera](https://keats.github.io/tera/) template.

commit_parsers.description: Commits that don't match any of the commit parsers are skipped.

commit_preprocessors.description: An array of commit preprocessors for manipulating the commit messages before parsing/grouping them.

header.description: Text at the beginning of the changelog.

link_parsers.description: An array of link parsers for extracting external references, and turning them into URLs, using regex.

protect_breaking_commits.description: Whether to protect all breaking changes from being skipped by a commit parser.

sort_commits.description: How to sort the commits inside the various sections.

tag_pattern.description: A regular expression for matching the git tags to add to the changelog.

trim.description: If set to `true`, leading and trailing whitespace are removed from [`Self::body`].

body.description: Regex for matching the commit body.

field.description: Field name of the commit to match the regex against.

message.description: Regex for matching the commit message.

pattern.description: Regex for matching the field value.

scope.description: Commit scope for overriding the default scope.

skip.description: Whether to skip this commit group.

href.description: The string used to generate the link URL.

pattern.description: Regex for finding links in the commit message.

text.description: The string used to generate the link text.

changelog_include.title: Changelog Include
changelog_include.description: List of package names. Include the changelogs of these packages in the changelog of the current package.

changelog_path.title: Changelog Path
changelog_path.description: Normally the changelog is placed in the same directory of the Cargo.toml file. The user can provide a custom path here. This `changelog_path` needs to be propagated to all the commands: `update`, `release-pr` and `release`.

changelog_update.title: Changelog Update
changelog_update.description: Whether to create/update changelog or not. If unspecified, the changelog is updated.

git_release_body.title: Git Release Body
git_release_body.description: Tera template of the git release body created by release-plz.

git_release_draft.title: Git Release Draft
git_release_draft.description: If true, will not auto-publish the release.

git_release_enable.title: Git Release Enable
git_release_enable.description: Publish the GitHub/Gitea release for the created git tag. Enabled by default.

git_release_name.title: Git Release Name
git_release_name.description: Tera template of the git release name created by release-plz.

git_release_type.title: Git Release Type
git_release_type.description: Whether to mark the created release as not ready for production.

git_tag_enable.title: Git Tag Enable
git_tag_enable.description: Publish the git tag for the new package version. Enabled by default.

git_tag_name.title: Git Tag Name
git_tag_name.description: Tera template of the git tag name created by release-plz.

publish_allow_dirty.title: Publish Allow Dirty
publish_allow_dirty.description: If `true`, add the `--allow-dirty` flag to the `cargo publish` command.

publish_features.title: Publish Features
publish_features.description: If `["a", "b", "c"]`, add the `--features=a,b,c` flag to the `cargo publish` command.

publish_no_verify.title: Publish No Verify
publish_no_verify.description: If `true`, add the `--no-verify` flag to the `cargo publish` command.

release.title: Release
release.description: Used to toggle off the update/release process for a workspace or package.

semver_check.title: Semver Check
semver_check.description: Controls when to run cargo-semver-checks. If unspecified, run cargo-semver-checks if the package is a library.

oneOf.title: Prod
oneOf.description: Will mark the release as ready for production.

oneOf.title: Pre
oneOf.description: Will mark the release as not ready for production. I.e. as pre-release.

oneOf.title: Auto
oneOf.description: Will mark the release as not ready for production in case there is a semver pre-release in the tag e.g. v1.0.0-rc1. Otherwise, will mark the release as ready for production.

pattern.description: Regex for matching a text to replace.

replace_command.description: Command that will be run for replacing the commit message.

allow_dirty.title: Allow Dirty
allow_dirty.description: - If `true`, allow dirty working directories to be updated. The uncommitted changes will be part of the update. - If `false` or [`Option::None`], the command will fail if the working directory is dirty.

changelog_config.title: Changelog Config
changelog_config.description: Path to the git cliff configuration file. Defaults to the `keep a changelog` configuration.

changelog_update.title: Changelog Update
changelog_update.description: Whether to create/update changelog or not. If unspecified, the changelog is updated.

dependencies_update.title: Dependencies Update
dependencies_update.description: - If `true`, update all the dependencies in the Cargo.lock file by running `cargo update`. - If `false` or [`Option::None`], only update the workspace packages by running `cargo update --workspace`.

git_release_body.title: Git Release Body
git_release_body.description: Tera template of the git release body created by release-plz.

git_release_draft.title: Git Release Draft
git_release_draft.description: If true, will not auto-publish the release.

git_release_enable.title: Git Release Enable
git_release_enable.description: Publish the GitHub/Gitea release for the created git tag. Enabled by default.

git_release_name.title: Git Release Name
git_release_name.description: Tera template of the git release name created by release-plz.

git_release_type.title: Git Release Type
git_release_type.description: Whether to mark the created release as not ready for production.

git_tag_enable.title: Git Tag Enable
git_tag_enable.description: Publish the git tag for the new package version. Enabled by default.

git_tag_name.title: Git Tag Name
git_tag_name.description: Tera template of the git tag name created by release-plz.

pr_draft.title: PR Draft
pr_draft.description: If `true`, the created release PR will be marked as a draft.

pr_labels.title: PR Labels
pr_labels.description: Labels to add to the release PR.

publish_allow_dirty.title: Publish Allow Dirty
publish_allow_dirty.description: If `true`, add the `--allow-dirty` flag to the `cargo publish` command.

publish_features.title: Publish Features
publish_features.description: If `["a", "b", "c"]`, add the `--features=a,b,c` flag to the `cargo publish` command.

publish_no_verify.title: Publish No Verify
publish_no_verify.description: If `true`, add the `--no-verify` flag to the `cargo publish` command.

release.title: Release
release.description: Used to toggle off the update/release process for a workspace or package.

release_always.title: Release always
release_always.description: - If true, release-plz release will try to release your packages every time you run it (e.g. on every commit in the main branch). *(Default)*. - If false, `release-plz release` will try release your packages only when you merge the release pr. Use this if you want to commit your packages and publish them later. To determine if a pr is a release-pr, release-plz will check if the branch of the PR starts with `release-plz-`. So if you want to create a PR that should trigger a release (e.g. when you fix the CI), use this branch name format (e.g. `release-plz-fix-ci`).

release_commits.title: Release Commits
release_commits.description: Prepare release only if at least one commit respects this regex.

repo_url.title: Repo URL
repo_url.description: GitHub/Gitea repository url where your project is hosted. It is used to generate the changelog release link. It defaults to the url of the default remote.

semver_check.title: Semver Check
semver_check.description: Controls when to run cargo-semver-checks. If unspecified, run cargo-semver-checks if the package is a library.
